title: Is a time machine invented? - Quora

response.answer_text: Time travel into the future happens all the time, but the effects are so tiny we don’t notice it. According to Einstein’s relativity, time slows down for people who are moving relative to another person, so it you get in a vehicle and move at high speed to a distant location, then return, when you get back your clock will be behind those of the people who stayed home. Do this fast enough and far enough, and a trip that takes you 10 seconds might find you coming back to a place that has experienced hours or days or years more than you did, so you have effectively moved into their future. For the effects to be obvious, the speed has to be a significant fraction of the speed of light. That’s so much faster than any current method of transportation that even for astronauts, the effect is not detectable with ordinary clocks, but it has been measured using atomic clocks in ordinary commercial airline flights. So the effect is tiny at ordinary speeds, but gets larger as you go faster, and gets much larger (without limit) as you get close to the speed of light. If you traveled very close to the speed of light, a trip that takes you only a few seconds could bring you back to a world that’s a million years in the future. So time machines already exist. Your car is one. But it’s a one-way time machine and can only travel into the future. Actually of course we are all always travelling into the future, but at what (normally) appears to be a fixed rate that’s the same for everyone. And that “appearance” is not quite exactly correct. Going _back_ in time is a much more difficult problem, since you run into the obvious “grandfather paradox” contradictions: what if you went back in time and killed one of your ancestors before they had conceived the child that was next in line between them and you in your family tree. Then you wouldn’t exist and couldn’t have traveled back in time in the first place.

Time machines have been around for over 120 years, the first known example was invented by these two chaps  They are of course Auguste and Louis Lumière. True the first machines were very crude  compared with those most of us routinely carry around with us today without knowing what they are. The only way there will ever be able to travel back in time is through the miracle of movie camera, video and, today, the smart phone. If you would like to travel back in time the easiest way is through you tube where it is simple to travel back 100 + years. Simple by clicking this arrow you can travel back to the year 1889  Of course you can not interact with those you see. You can only observe in amazement. Through the imagination of science fiction writers and filmmakers any thing is possible. But can you appreciate the utter confusion if it were ever possible to do what you are suggesting? I love science fiction time travel movies & books but that is all it will ever be, the figment of the author’s vivid imagination. The Moving Finger writes; and, having writ,Moves on: nor all thy Piety nor WitShall lure it back to cancel half a Line,Nor all thy Tears wash out a Word of it. Omar Khayyám “Yesterday has just departed And tomorrow hasn’t started All that matters is right now “ Cupid's Inspiration No, scientists didn’t just “reverse time” with a quantum computer I suggest you read this article carefully before you hop into your time machines to put the world to right.
